subject: p14841168
History: Woman with ESRD T/Th/S HD, pulmonary HTN on 2L nc at home, T2DM s/p R AKA, HFpEF, multiple prior DVTs on chronic Warfarin, R AKA in for gangrene, ischemic bowel s/p R colectomy end ileostomy presenting with R AKA stump pain concerning for infection sent to MICU for septic shock now s/p R AKA stump wound ulcer debridement on called out to the medical floor. , Eval for PNA Eval for PNA.
Impression: In comparison with the study of, there is little overall change. Again there is increased opacification in the left mid and lower lung zones. Although this could merely represent extensive atelectasis, in the appropriate clinical setting superimposed pneumonia would have to be seriously considered. Continued low lung volumes with enlargement of the cardiac silhouette and mild pulmonary vascular congestion.
